meanings.sent1: The new law will legitimatize the use of electric scooters on the sidewalks.
meanings.sent2: The judge will legitimatize the contract once all the necessary signatures are in place.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to legitimatize his disappearing act by claiming it was all part of the show.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work and dedication legitimatized her position as the team captain.
meanings.sent5: The certificate will legitimatize your qualifications for the job.

meanings.definition: To give official approval or recognition to.
meanings.sent1: The city council will legitimatize the new building project at the next meeting.
meanings.sent2: The principal will legitimatize the student council elections by overseeing the process.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to legitimatize his unauthorized entry into the kitchen by wagging his tail innocently.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style legitimatized her as a prominent figure in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The royal seal will legitimatize the document as an official decree.
